solution.text:
Given expression :
_{k}_\(\times\)_{{k+5}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(j+3*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(j+i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(2*j+3*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(2*j+2*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(3*j+i)}}_\(\times\)tan45\(\times\)tan_{{45+(3*j+i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45+(2*j+2*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45+(2*j+3*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45+(j+i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45+(j+3*i)}}_
if you carefully see on the right side of tan(45) each angle is a complementary angle of one of the angle of left side
hence, all the angles of right side can be written as cot of 90 minus that angle. i.e. tan(A)=cot(90-A)
which gives
tan_{{45-(j+3*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(j+i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(2*j+3*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(2*j+2*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(3*j+i)}}_\(\times\)tan45\(\times\)cot_{{90-(45+(3*j+i))}}_\(\times\)cot_{{90-(45+(2*j+2*i))}}_\(\times\)cot_{{90-(45+(2*j+3*i))}}_\(\times\)cot_{{90-(45+(j+i))}}_\(\times\)cot_{{90-(45+(j+3*i))}}_
We know that cot(A)=\(1\over tan(A)\)
using above given identity, expression can be written as :
_{k}_\(\times\)_{{k+5}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(j+3*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(j+i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(2*j+3*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(2*j+2*i)}}_\(\times\)tan_{{45-(3*j+i)}}_\(\times\)tan45\(\times\)\(1\over tan_{{90-(45+(3*j+i))}}_\)\(\times\)\(1\over tan_{{90-(45+(2*j+2*i))}}_\)\(\times\)\(1\over tan_{{90-(45+(2*j+3*i))}}_\)\(\times\)\(1\over tan_{{90-(45+(j+i))}}_\)\(\times\)\(1\over tan_{{90-(45+(j+3*i))}}_\)
expression will reduce to_{{k*(k+5)}}_\(\times\) tan45
we know tan45=1, so finally we get _{{k*(k+5)}}_
